alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 18 at 3:46PM HST until February 18 at 7:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County * Until 700 PM HST. * At 346 PM HST, the Hawaii County Civil Defense Agency reported that Highway 11 at Kawa Flats, Wood Valley Road, and Kaalaiki Road were still closed in the Kau District. These roads will likely remain closed tonight as runoff levels remain high. Kahikopele Street in the Eden Roc subdivision was still closed. Radar and rain gages indicated that moderate to heavy rainfall was still moving over the South Hilo, Puna, and Kau Districts from the southeast. Peak rain rates were around 1 inch per hour. Periods of heavy rainfall will continue through tonight. HAZARD...Heavy rain producing life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Significant and life threatening flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low lying areas. Multiple roads have been closed. Landslides are expected in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Volcano, Glenwood, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Mountain View, Wood Valley, Hawaiian Acres, Keaau, Orchidland Estates, Pahala, Papaikou, Pepeekeo, Pahoa, Punaluu Beach and Honomu. This warning may need to be extended beyond 700 PM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Routes such as Wood Valley Road and Kaalaiki Road have many low water crossings that are flooded. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown. Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts.
